thread.title: Justice Department and FBI to Brief Lawmakers on Trump Campaign Informant - WSJ

author: Aruna Viswanatha
title: Justice Department and FBI to Brief Lawmakers on Trump Campaign Informant - WSJ

organizations.name: trump campaign informant - wsj senior justice department

text:
Senior Justice Department and FBI officials are set to brief lawmakers Thursday afternoon about a confidential informant used in the early stages of an investigation into Russian meddling in the 2016 election, scrambling to accommodate Democrats who had complained that the briefing would be a GOP-only affair.
Late Wednesday, the Justice Department announced it would hold two meetings on Thursday instead of the initial single briefing it had earlier announced for Republican Reps. Devin Nunes of California and Trey Gowdy of... RELATED VIDEO How Russian Trolls Collected Americans' Personal Information The Kremlin-backed Internet Research Agency, a.k.a. the Troll Factory, ​used fake social media accounts before and after the 2016 U.S. election to collect sensitive personal information on Americans, a Wall Street Journal investigation has found. Shelby Holliday explains how the Russian schemes worked.​ To Read the Full Story Subscribe Sign In
